questions.question_text:
An architect is helping an organization with the Conceptual Design of an NSX-T Data Center solution.
This information was gathered by the architect during the Discover Task of the Engagement Lifecycle:
✑ There are applications which use IPv6 addressing.
✑ Network administrators are not familiar with NSX-T Data Center solutions.
✑ Hosts can only be configured with two physical NICs.
✑ There is an existing management cluster to deploy the NSX-T components.
✑ Dynamic routing should be configured between the physical and virtual network.
✑ There is a storage array available to deploy NSX-T components.
Which two requirements were documented by the architect? (Choose two.)

comments.content: Agree with you. AB. because if you have IPv6, it is then a requirement that the design accommodates IPv6 as well. D is an info as part of scope. not a requirement.

discussion.content:
Correct Answers are A & B

C is a constraint, D is an assumption and E is a risk.

Selected Answer: AB
Correct Answer: AB
a requirement is something that "you must do". A is just a statement of fact. A is not written as a requirement would be. B and C.

AB is correct.
D can be an assumption or information gathered during the information gathering workshop with the customer.

choices.C: Hosts can only be configured with two physical NICs.
choices.E: Network administrators are not familiar with NSX-T Data Center solutions.
choices.B: Dynamic routing should be configured between the physical and virtual network.
choices.A: There are applications which use IPv6 addressing.
choices.D: The storage array has enough capacity to deploy NSX components.

discussion.content:
correct answer BCD
E -> is not correct there is nu budget for new servers
A -> an bare metal edge for a 4 node cluster is an overkill and single point of failure

BCD is Correct Answer.
B: 4xNode is fit for consolidate architecture for Prod & Mgmt resource pool.
C: Can deploy 2xEdge Node on Mgmt pool and conf Host Anti-Affinity for those VMs
D: 2x Nic is mandatory requirement. 
A: Single bare-mental node for N-S is not recommend.
E: No budget for new cluster.

Selected Answer: BCD
BCD is correct
Correct Answers: C, D, E. If A is correct then C does not make sense. D still can be correct because it is not a new server which cannot be purchased but network cards.

choices.E: Install Edge nodes on a separate cluster.
choices.A: Remove one of the ESXi hosts and install a bare-metal Edge.
choices.D: Recommend obtaining 2 new physical NICs for the servers.
choices.B: Use a resource pool for production workloads.
choices.C: Use a resource pool to deploy the Edge nodes on.

questions.question_text:
An NSX-T Architect is working in a brownfield environment with 4 ESXi hosts. These constraints were documented:
✑ new servers cannot be purchased
✑ North/South bandwidth must be guaranteed
✑ Top-of-Rack switches have additional uplinks
Which three recommendations should the architect implement? (Choose three.)

choices.A: Configure Tier-0 gateway for eBGP and ECMP.
choices.E: Configure multiple static routes on Tier-1 gateway.
choices.B: Configure Tier-1 gateway for eBGP and ECMP.
choices.D: Install and configure hosts with 100Gbps physical NICs.

questions.question_text:
An architect is helping an organization with the Physical Design of an NSX-T Data Center solution.
This information was gathered during the Assessment Phase:
✑ There is a critical application used by the Finance Team.
✑ The critical application has an availability and recoverability SLA of 99.999%.
✑ The critical application is sensitive to network changes.
Which two selections should an architect include in their design? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Correct is AC



A. Configure Tier-0 gateway for eBGP and ECMP.
B. Configure Tier-1 gateway for eBGP and ECMP. / T1 can't be configured to use BGP and ECMP
C. Enable BFD on Tier-0 gateway.
D. Install and configure hosts with 100Gbps physical NICs. / Unrelated to question
E. Configure multiple static routes on Tier-1 gateway. / Incorrect. T1 routes are created as direct connected routes, if T1 is DR then it has ECMP to T0 by defau;t..

questions.question_text:
An architect is helping an organization with the Physical Design of an NSX-T Data Center solution.
This information was gathered during a workshop:
✑ There are six hosts and hardware has already been purchased.
✑ Customer is planning a collapsed Management/Edge/Compute cluster.
✑ Each host has two 10Gb NICs connected to a pair of switches.
✑ There should be no single point of failure in any proposed design.
Which virtual switch design should the architect recommend to the organization? (Choose the best answer.)

discussion.content: with NSX-T 3.0 and vSphere 7.0 we can use vDS instead of nVDS , ill go with C with the options I have

Selected Answer: C
"No single point of failure"
You have no choice but to assign MGMT and overlay traffic on each nic

C is correct. 
Both 10Gb NICs must be assigned to a virtual switch to avoid a single point of failure.

Selected Answer: C
C is the correct one for using the 2 nics

The correct answer is C. 

Options A & B is incorrect as it talks about a single NIC for both VDS & N-VDS. As per the requirement, there should not be a single failure in the proposed design.

D is wrong as hosts only have 2 PNICs. Option D talks about adding a new NIC to NVDS

choices.D: Create an NSX-T Virtual Distributed Switch (N-VDS) for Management VMkernel and overlay traffic and assign a new virtual NIC.
choices.C: Create an NSX-T Virtual Distributed Switch (N-VDS) for Management VMKernel and overlay traffic and assign both NICs.
choices.A: Create a vSphere Distributed Switch (vDS) for Management VMkernel traffic and assign one NIC. Also, create an NSX-T Virtual Distributed Switch (N-VDS) for overlay traffic and assign one NIC.
choices.B: Create an NSX-T Virtual Distributed Switch (N-VDS) for Management VMkernel traffic and assign one NIC. Also, create an NSX-T Virtual Distributed Switch (N-VDS) for overlay traffic and assign one NIC.
